intro: Ixora morsei, commonly known as the Madagascar flame tree, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many tropical shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its bright red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters, creating a striking visual display. Ixora morsei typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a leathery texture, contributing to its ornamental value in horticulture.
